19 hours ago Europe Link: /news/topic/europe

Turkey debates status of iconic Hagia Sofia Link: /news/turkey-debates-status-of-iconic-hagia-sofia

In its more than 1,400-year existence, the majestic domed structure of Hagia Sophia in Istanbul has served as the Byzantine Empire's main cathedral, a mosque under the Ottoman Empire and a museum under modern Turkey, attracting millions of tourists each year. The 6th-century building is now at the centre of a heated debate between nationalist, conservative and religious groups who are pressing for it to be reconverted back into a mosque.

Read More Link: /news/turkey-debates-status-of-iconic-hagia-sofia

Brazil's military hand out masks to protect isolated Amazon tribes Link: /news/brazil-s-military-hand-out-masks-to-protect-isolated-amazon-tribes

Army soldiers handed out face masks to the Yanomami indigenous people. The Yanomami are the last major isolated people in the Amazon where the coronavirus pandemic has spread to. Dozens of indigenous communities have been infected with COVID-19 latest outside disease to threaten decimation of the rainforest inhabitants.

The ongoing coronavirus pandemic has reduced many people to poverty in Chile. Santiago, a city of six million, largely depends on the informal economy and protests which broke out in October and raged until mid-December over social injustices and entrenched inequality also affected many businesses.
